profile.name: Steve Harrington
profile.currentTitle: Shift Manager, Family Video / Former Scoops Ahoy Associate
profile.headline: Retail team leader and accidental crisis responder who has survived more existential threats than most military veterans. Known for stepping up when it matters, mentoring younger team members, and delivering surprisingly effective customer service.
profile.executiveSummary: Former high school athlete turned retail professional who discovered unexpected leadership abilities during a series of extreme crisis events in Hawkins, Indiana. While his resume might look like standard retail experience, Steve has repeatedly demonstrated crisis leadership, protective instincts, and team coordination skills that belie his job title. Currently managing shifts at Family Video while serving as de facto team leader for an ad hoc crisis response group.

evidence.outcome: Maintained positive customer satisfaction ratings across two retail positions
evidence.description: Provided friendly, knowledgeable service at Scoops Ahoy and Family Video despite unconventional work disruptions

evidence.outcome: Developed product knowledge enabling personalized movie recommendations at Family Video
evidence.description: Built expertise in film catalog to provide tailored recommendations driving repeat customer visits

evidence.outcome: Led civilian defense during 4 existential threat events with zero casualties among team members
evidence.description: Organized and directed untrained group of teenagers through situations that would challenge trained military personnel

evidence.outcome: Coordinated tactical response at Starcourt Mall under extreme duress
evidence.description: Directed team movement, resource allocation, and defensive positioning during sustained threat engagement

evidence.outcome: Mentored Dustin Henderson through personal development and crisis situations
evidence.description: Provided guidance, emotional support, and practical life advice to younger team member across multiple years

evidence.outcome: Served as protective role model for group of 6 younger team members
evidence.description: Stepped into de facto big brother role providing leadership, protection, and emotional stability

evidence.outcome: Engaged and survived hand-to-hand combat against both human and non-human threats
evidence.description: Applied athletic ability and improvised weapons effectively in multiple physical confrontations

evidence.outcome: Managed daily cash operations with 100% accuracy at two retail locations
evidence.description: Handled cash transactions, daily reconciliation, and deposit preparation

evidence.outcome: Managed video inventory of 5,000+ titles at Family Video
evidence.description: Tracked inventory, processed returns, managed late fees, and maintained shelf organization

evidence.outcome: Operated ice cream service counter at Scoops Ahoy in Starcourt Mall
evidence.description: Prepared ice cream products, maintained food safety standards, and managed customer queue

evidence.outcome: Served as primary driver/logistics for crisis response team across 4 events
evidence.description: Provided reliable transportation under dangerous conditions including high-speed pursuit scenarios

evidence.outcome: Provided basic first aid to team members during and after crisis events
evidence.description: Applied wound care, stabilization, and recovery support for injured team members

evidence.outcome: Former varsity basketball player applying athleticism to crisis response situations
evidence.description: Leveraged athletic conditioning, coordination, and competitive instincts in physical confrontations

evidence.outcome: Consistently placed himself between threats and younger team members
evidence.description: Made instinctive decisions to protect others at personal risk across all crisis events

evidence.outcome: Volunteered for most dangerous assignments despite having no obligation or training
evidence.description: Stepped up repeatedly when he could have walked away, facing threats far beyond his experience level

evidence.outcome: Transitioned from popular athlete to retail worker without ego or bitterness
evidence.description: Accepted changed circumstances with grace, finding purpose in service and mentoring rather than status

evidence.outcome: 100% attendance when team needed support during crisis events
evidence.description: Never failed to show up when friends needed help, regardless of personal risk or inconvenience

evidence.outcome: Adapted from normal teenage life to repeated crisis response without psychological breakdown
evidence.description: Demonstrated remarkable ability to process extreme experiences and continue functioning

evidence.outcome: Provided clear, calm direction to team members during high-stress situations
evidence.description: Communicated effectively under pressure, keeping team informed and coordinated

workHistory.title: Shift Manager
workHistory.description: Managing shifts, customer service, and inventory at video rental store. Providing movie recommendations and maintaining store operations.

workHistory.title: Associate
workHistory.description: Ice cream counter service. Position ended when Starcourt Mall was destroyed in an incident officially attributed to a fire.

purpose: I'm not the hero type. But when the kids need someone? I grab the bat.
